[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.state_change_hash] [Empty hash injection] Can empty or zero-value state_change_hash strings be inserted for transactions that should have state changes, indicating potential state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.state_change_hash] [Format inconsistency] Can state_change_hash be in different formats (hex, base64, raw bytes) causing comparison failures across different BigQuery queries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.event_root_hash] [Event tampering] Can the event_root_hash be forged to hide or fabricate events in BigQuery without affecting the actual blockchain state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.event_root_hash] [Merkle tree verification bypass] Is the event_root_hash validated against num_events, or can mismatches indicate event injection/suppression attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.event_root_hash] [Zero event hash] Can transactions with num_events=0 have non-zero event_root_hash, indicating a validation gap that could hide phantom events? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.state_checkpoint_hash] [Optional field abuse] Since state_checkpoint_hash is optional, can its absence be exploited to hide checkpoint transactions or inject fake checkpoints by setting it when it should be None? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.state_checkpoint_hash] [Checkpoint forgery] Can arbitrary state_checkpoint_hash values be inserted without validation, allowing attackers to create fake recovery points in analytics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.state_checkpoint_hash] [Proto2 default value bug] Per the proto2 comment, can the 'optional' state_checkpoint_hash with default value be ignored by BigQuery, causing None to map to empty string and breaking checkpoint detection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.gas_used] [Gas underflow attack] Since gas_used is u64, can overflow during summation in BigQuery queries cause negative gas totals when aggregated across epochs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.gas_used] [Zero gas injection] Can gas_used=0 be inserted for transactions that should consume gas, hiding actual gas consumption and breaking economic analysis? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.gas_used] [Gas limit bypass detection] Is there validation that gas_used never exceeds maximum transaction gas limits, or can inflated values indicate gas metering bugs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.gas_used] [Failed transaction gas] Can failed transactions (success=false) have gas_used=0, breaking the invariant that all transactions consume gas for validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.gas_used] [Maximum value injection] Can gas_used=u64::MAX be injected to break gas accounting queries or cause overflow in fee calculations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.success] [Success flag manipulation] Can the success boolean be inverted during serialization to hide failed transactions or mark fraudulent transactions as successful in analytics? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.success] [Success without state changes] Can success=true transactions have zero num_write_set_changes, indicating validation gaps or state-less transaction attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.success] [VM status contradiction] Is there validation that success=false transactions have error-indicating vm_status strings, or can contradictions hide execution failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.vm_status] [Status string injection] Can arbitrary vm_status strings be injected to hide critical VM errors like out-of-gas or access violations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.vm_status] [Error message sanitization] Can vm_status contain unsanitized error messages that leak internal state or system paths? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.bigquery_schema.transaction.v1.rs] [Field: Transaction.vm_status] [Success/status mismatch] Can success=true with vm_status='EXECUTION_FAILURE' be inserted, indicating a critical validation gap in transaction finalization? (Critical)
